data.title: Staff Directory - The Peddie School
data.meta_description: The Peddie School directory of all staff including Frequently Dialed Numbers such as security, press and media, health services.
data.text:
Peter Quinn P’15 ’18 ’21 was appointed the 16th head of school in 2013. His appointment was a homecoming to Peddie, where he had served as a teacher, coach, dorm supervisor, college counselor and admission director between 1985 and 1996. Quinn oversaw the Peddie Admission Office in the years immediately following the school’s $100 million gift from Walter H. Annenberg ’27. He was noted for his focus on Peddie’s mission during the transformative years when the Annenberg Scholarship Program was created and applications to the school tripled.Immediately prior to his return to Peddie, Quinn was the headmaster of Wakefield School in Virginia for seventeen years. He is credited with vastly improving the school by increasing enrollment, faculty and staff, acreage, playing fields and infrastructure. He has also taught at the Hackley School.Peter Quinn is a son of James H. McK. Quinn, headmaster of The Episcopal Academy (1957-1975), and a grandson of Rev. Albert H. Lucas, headmaster of St. Alban’s School (1929-1949). Two of his siblings are also life-long teachers. He and his wife, Maryanne, have three children and reside on campus.

Alison Hogarth joined Peddie’s History Department in 2006 after nine years of teaching history at the Harvard-Westlake School in Los Angeles, taking the helm as department chair in 2017. Hogarth introduced the government program to the department, which now offers Intro to Government, AP Government and American Legal Systems, and also worked to develop the Modern Global curriculum. Hogarth served as co-chair of the school’s accreditation process from 2014-2016. As a teacher in residence, Hogarth organizes student elections, serves on the Disciplinary Committee and officiates as head timer for varsity basketball and field hockey. Hogarth lives on campus and is part of the Coleman Dormitory faculty team.

“My number one priority is to help my students become critical consumers of information and consider the credibility of the content they consume.”

After teaching for eight years in Spain, José Ruiz joined Peddie in 2003, and is currently chair of the Language Department. He lives on campus with his wife, Rocio, who serves as residential faculty in Masters Dormitory and their two falcons, Elia Ruiz ’23 and Liam Ruiz ’25.Ruiz coaches cross country and indoor track and serves as a student advisor. He has spent several summers as a program director with the Middlebury-Monterey Language Academy summer program, where he helps high school students fully immerse themselves in a foreign culture. Ruiz strives to spark students’ cultural curiosity in his language classes.

“Giving students insight into the life and people of another country creates a context for the practice of grammar and vocabulary and translates to a much stronger sense of purpose and connection.”

Shivani Agarwal P’25 joined Peddie in 2023 as the school’s inaugural director of human resources. Reporting to the head of school, she is responsible for providing strategic human resource leadership at Peddie, including the management of policies, practices and procedures. Prior to Peddie, she worked in several corporate HR roles in California and also led the HR operations of one of Asia’s oldest boarding schools. Shivani is a senior professional in human resources (SPHR) and earned her master’s degree in economics and an MBA from GB Pant University, India.

Christine Benitez joined Peddie’s Business Office in 2021. She was formerly the chief financial officer for The Children’s Home Society. Prior to that she spent 23 years working for Catholic Charities Diocese of Metuchen, where she rose through the ranks to become CFO, a position she held for 17 years. Christine is a licensed certified public account. She earned her Bachelor of Arts in psychology from The College of New Jersey and a Master of Business Administration in professional accounting from Rutgers University.

Bryn Bennett ’09 joined Peddie’s Admission Office in 2015 and serves as an associate director of admission. Outside of the typical admission officer responsibilities, her main role in the office is organizing in-person and virtual events. Bryn serves as an advisor and does dorm duty in Masters Dormitory with tenth-grade students who identify as female. Bryn lives on campus with her husband, Kurt (English), their baby, Reece, and dog, Leroy.

Since 2015, Ryan Bennett has served Peddie as technology director and as a math teacher. In the winter of 2021, Ryan also added assistant wrestling coach to his job duties. A graduate of Western Michigan University and University of Phoenix, Ryan previously served as a technology director, teacher, coach and advisor at The Leelenau School and Mercersburg Academy. Prior to that he was a mathematics teacher in the Kalamazoo Public Schools. Ryan serves on Peddie’s administrative team and is a member of the residential faculty in Avery Dormitory. In his free time, Ryan volunteers as a firefighter and emergency rescue diver for the Hightstown Fire Department.

Nika Blank joined Peddie in 2022 as a member of our science faculty. She graduated with her Master of Science in biological oceanography and received her Bachelor of Science in environmental science, both from Florida State University. Prior to Peddie, Nika was a research assistant at the Florida State University Coastal and Marine Lab, working on shallow-water and deep sea coral ecosystems, she was a STEM educator at Challenger Learning Center of Tallahassee and a teaching assistant at both Florida State University and The Hun School. Nika resides on campus and is affiliated with Masters Thirds. Outside of the classroom, she is a dorm supervisor and an assistant coach for Peddie’s swim team.

Kevin Brown P’25 joined Peddie in 2008. He received his Bachelor of Engineering in chemical engineering from Cooper Union, and his Master of Science in environmental management from University of London. Brown’s research experience includes work in nuclear chemistry for the US Department of Energy, chemical engineering for South Bank University in London and virology for Academia Sinica in Taipei. Previously he has also been business manager for a daily newspaper, presentation graphics specialist for an investment bank, as well as a dean and science teacher at Pace Academy in Atlanta. Brown is the director of Peddie Summer School, and is a mentor for Peddie’s FRC robotics team. He resides on campus with his wife, Maxine Brown (Counseling Department) and their two children.

A 1992 Peddie graduate, Marc Buchner P’23 earned a degree in computer science and engineering from Bucknell University. He returned to campus in 2004 after three years of teaching in New Hampshire. In his time at Peddie, Buchner has taught various math courses, been a dorm supervisor and acted as the assistant director of athletics, interim director of athletics and sophomore class dean. He earned a Masters in Educational Leadership from Villanova in 2009 and currently serves as chair of the Math Department . He lives on campus with his wife and two children.

Andrew Caglieris P’10 ’15 joined Peddie’s Mathematics Department in 2005. A graduate of University of London, University of Edinburgh and Columbia University, Caglieris served on the faculty of Phoenix Country Day School, Horace Mann School and Spencer Park School prior to Peddie. He is part of the dorm faculty team for Mariboe Dormitory and is an assistant coach for boys junior varsity soccer. Andrew serves on the board of The Better Beginnings Child Development Center in Hightstown and resides on campus.

Originally from upstate New York, Joyce Chen earned her B.F.A. and M.A.T. degrees from Rhode Island School of Design in 2013 and 2014. Before coming to Peddie in 2017, Chen student-taught in public schools in Providence, Rhode Island and taught high school art in Newark, New Jersey. Having taught visual arts in remote and hybrid situations, Chen became interested in improving online learning. As a result, she returned to school in 2022, completing her M.S. in education the following year in learning sciences and technology from the University of Pennsylvania. In her spare time, Joyce enjoys frequenting museums and arts events.

Mark Cirnigliaro joined Peddie’s Theater Department in 2018, after previous work as a director, teaching artist and adjunct professor in various theater and university settings. Cirnigliaro revised the Theater Foundations class to be more holistic in its approach to theater as an art form, including puppetry, directing, design and play writing. He also revised Advanced Acting to be driven through Uta Hagens’ approach to acting. Cirnigliaro has had world-renowned playwrights teach master classes in playwriting, and Broadway stars teach master classes in Musical Theater. In addition, Mark has created a new puppetry class where students build and perform with their own puppets, and a set design class where students learn the art form and get to design one of Peddie’s main stage productions. He is the advisor for Art-Ivism, Drama Club, Dumbledore’s Army and Magic Club. Cirnigliaro oversees the Peddie Declamation Contest, Spring Play, Winter Musical and The Reeves Speaking Contest. He resides on campus with his family and is part of the Potter South Dormitory faculty team.

Heather Comisky is a registered nurse with over 20 years experience. She is a nursing leader and health educator, and holds her Bachelor of Science in nursing from the University of Delaware. Heather also enjoys teaching the 10th grade community life classes at Peddie, certifying the 10th grade students, nursing & security staff in CPR, and being a part of the Peddie community.

Before accepting her position at Peddie in 2010, Sarah Venanzi completed her doctoral degree in chemistry at Duke University. Venanzi graduated from Randolph-Macon College in 2005 with a Bachelor of Science in chemistry and a minor in biology. She was a member of the Randolph-Macon women’s basketball team, serving as captain in her junior and senior years. Venanzi is a graduate of Ephrata Senior High School (Pa.), where she was a three-year letter winner in basketball and a captain her senior year. She serves as the director of residential life and teaches chemistry. Venanzi resides on campus in Caspersen Dormitory with her husband, three children and dog, Greta!

Craig Dale P’24 joined Peddie’s Visual Arts Department in 2019 after a long professional career as a freelance photographer and exhibiting artist. Dale has taught photography and color theory to graduate and undergraduate students at the Academy of Art San Francisco, and design thinking to undergraduate students at the New School for Architecture and Design. He received his Associate of Arts from Cabrillo College, his Bachelor of Arts in photography from Brooks Institute, and his Master of Fine Arts in visual art from Vermont College of Fine Arts. Dale earned his teaching credential from New Jersey City University, and is currently doing post-graduate work focused on visual literacy at the University of Rhode Island. In addition to his teaching obligations, Dale is an advisor for Peddie’s Film Club and Pics at Peddie. He is also the assistant technical director for theater set crew, and is proudly the AP Studio Art teacher. He is a member of the Kaye North Dormitory faculty team and lives on campus with his daughter.

Drew Davis joined Peddie’s English Department in the fall of 2022. She graduated from Lafayette College with a Bachelor of Arts in behavioral economics and received her Master of Education from the University of Pennsylvania. Davis coaches indoor and outdoor track and field. She lives in Masters North and does dorm duty there as well.

Since 2001, Brian Dubrule P’17 ’19 has served as the director of the Walter H. Annenberg ’27 Library, as well as the girls varsity tennis head coach. Prior to Peddie, Brian worked as a librarian, director of technology and tennis coach at St. Peter’s Prep. He lives on campus with his wife and four children.

Doreen Duck joined the Deans’ Office in 2015. Having previously worked in Roosevelt Public School as the assistant to the business administrator, she brings a wealth of administrative knowledge. An integral part of the organization and communication of the Deans’ Office, she is a touchpoint for all Peddie students.

Grant Edwards joined Peddie’s English Department in 2017. Edwards brings ten years teaching and coaching experience from St. Paul’s School in New Hampshire. He is proud to serve on the Head’s Advisory Committee, and as the faculty representative to the Board of Trustees. Edwards resides on campus and shares supervisory duty of Kaye North Dormitory. Grant became a part of Peddie’s College Counseling Office in 2020, and works with juniors and seniors during their college searches, while also teaching freshmen in the interdisciplinary Humanities program.Edwards is also varsity head coach for cross country and is an avid runner, running cross country and track in high school, and completing four half marathons. The cross country team won the coveted MAPL title in the fall of 2018 under his coaching. In addition, Grant is an assistant coach for girls varsity basketball.

Originally from Poland, Karolina Fraczkowska P’21 ’24 joined Peddie’s Science Department faculty in 2016, although her family has been connected to Peddie since 2001. Fraczkowska has been teaching chemistry, AP chemistry, AP biology and genetics in private schools since 2007, and was a teaching assistant in both biochemistry and experimental biology courses at M.I.T. A life-long learner, she is currently pursuing her Master of Art degree in liberal arts from St. John’s College in Annapolis, Md., and is teaching an English class in the spring trimester, “Crime and Punishment”. In her free time, Karolina is learning to play the banjo.

Desmond Frost joined Peddie’s Science Department faculty in 2021. He received his Bachelor of Science in physics with a double minor in chemistry and mathematics from West Chester University in 2013. He then went on to receive his Master of Education in curriculum and instruction from George Mason University in 2021. He has eight years of experience teaching physics, as well as AP physics. He resides on campus and serves as a dorm faculty member for Kaye North.

Mark Gartner ’84 P’08 ’10 joined the faculty of Peddie’s Mathematics Department in 1990 after previously teaching at Trinity-Pawling School. In addition to his classes, he provides extra support for students in the Math Center, and also worked to develop the MPS2 Core Curriculum. He and his wife Ann (athletics) reside off campus and have two sons.

Aimee Goodman joined Peddie as director of health services in 2018. She received her Bachelor of Science from Muhlenberg College, and her D.O. from Lake Erie College of Osteopathic Medicine. Dr. Goodman was previously employed in private practice pediatrics for twelve years, she now lives on campus with her family.

Kristen Gounis has been working in the Admission Office since 2010. Kristen earned both her undergraduate and graduate degrees in marketing and finance from Iona College. Prior to Peddie, Kristen spent eight years in the marketing department of a professional services firm in New York City with a focus on database marketing.

Katie Grant joined the Alumni & Development Office as the associate director of The Peddie Fund. Grant came to Peddie after spending seven years in higher education fundraising and alumni engagement. She works to build relationships and develop opportunities to keep alumni engaged and connected with their alma mater and giving back in ways that are most meaningful to them. Grant received her Bachelor of Arts in psychology from Franklin & Marshall College, where she was also an All-American swimmer.

Barb Grudt has served as trustee liaison and director of rowing/head girls rowing coach at Peddie since 2007. As trustee liaison, Grudt coordinates the work of Peddie’s Board of Trustees. She also serves as director of the Sports Hall of Fame. Grudt holds a B.A. and an M.S.Ed. from the University of Pennsylvania and is a two-time Olympian.

Laura-Lee Hensle Radtke ’92 joined the Alumni and Development Department in 2015, bringing over twenty years of experience in special events planning. Laura-Lee earned her Bachelor of Science in management and marketing from Elmira College and an M.B.A. in hospitality management from Johnson and Wales University. She serves as director of special events managing alumni and parent events both on campus and around the world.

Laura Hoffman P’25 joined Peddie’s Mathematics Department in 2013. She has taught mathematics in various public and private high schools since 1999, and also taught online for K12.com. Hoffman received her Bachelor of Arts in mathematics-secondary education from Providence College from Lesley University, and her Master of Arts in technology in education . Previously, Hoffman performed freelance curriculum development and design for Microsoft, Words & Numbers and the Research and Education Foundation. Laura is a freshman advisor, chair of the DEIJ Subcommittee in the Mathematics Department, and is currently participating in the SEED Cohort.

Brooke Kienle has been an admission interviewer for Peddie since 2019. Her experience includes serving as director of admission and director of college counseling at The TEAK Fellowship and as college counselor with Prep for Prep, both in New York City. Kienle received her Master of Arts from Teachers College, Columbia University, and her Bachelor of Arts in both English and psychology from the University of Pennsylvania.

Melissa Kramer joined Peddie’s Athletics and Strategic Marketing and Communications Departments in November 2022. As the sports information coordinator, Melissa gathers the latest scores from Peddie athletic teams and shares accomplishments to the Peddie athletics social media accounts, while also telling stories. She graduated from SUNY New Paltz with a bachelor’s degree in digital media and journalism, and a communications studies minor. Prior to joining Peddie, she worked in the sports media and journalism industries.

Imad Labban P’10 ’12 ’14 joined Peddie’s Mathematics Department and Robotics faculty in 2012. His previous work experience encompasses a variety of roles, including mechanical engineer for Saudi Aramco and managing director for Lehman Brothers and Barclays Capital. Labban developed curriculum for financial markets and is a two-time recipient of the Dr. Wilbour Eddy Saunders Society Award for Excellence in Classroom Teaching. He is investment advisor for the Peddie School Student Investment Committee (PSSIC), the YEC Business Club and is involved in Peddie’s FIRST Robotics Team. Labban spent three years on the Board of Trustees and is faculty chair for the Campaign Executive Committee.

Susie Lloyd P’13 ’14 ’16 ’16 came to Peddie in 1993 as a history teacher and as a coach for field hockey and lacrosse. Her previous experience includes teaching and coaching at The Garrison Forest School and Severn School, admission work at Kenyon College and the director of college counseling at The Boys’ Latin School. After taking several years off to be a full-time mother to her four daughters (all Peddie graduates), she returned to Peddie in the Admission Office where she has been since 2002. Susie earned her bachelor’s degree in history from Kenyon College.

Richard Arthur Lloyd joined Peddie’s Technology Department in 1996, having previously worked as a database administrator at the School of Mathematics at the Institute for Advanced Study in Princeton, where he handled the admission application process, as well as developed and designed the school’s original website presence. He presently resides in nearby Allentown with his wife, Alice. He has been with the Technology Department since the inception of its laptop program, the second oldest 100% 1:1 program in the United States.

Shannon Madden ’13 joined the Alumni & Development Office in July 2021 and is currently the associate director of The Peddie Fund and engagement. Shannon comes to Peddie after spending four years working in the advertising industry at a media agency, where she developed strategy recommendations for a global consumer packaged goods brand. In her role, Shannon focuses on increasing participation for Peddie’s annual fund as well as building out alumni engagement efforts for volunteers and affinity groups. Shannon received her Bachelor of Science in business administration from Babson College, where she was also a member of the softball team. Shannon is the assistant coach for varsity softball, supporting today’s students as they develop as student athletes and ultimately join the ranks of Peddie alumni.

Mary Mahoney ’94 joined Alumni and Development in 2009 having previously worked as a corporate campus recruiter. She earned her bachelor’s degree from the College of the Holy Cross. As director of The Peddie Fund and leadership giving, Mary oversees initiatives to raise unrestricted, annual support of Peddie from alumni, parents and friends while also focusing on engaging and strengthening alumni and parent relationships with the school.

Peter McClellan ’90 P’19 ’21 ’25 is a Peddie native and brings a lifetime of experience to his role as a faculty member. McClellan taught and coached at Westfield High School for seven years before rejoining Peddie in 2003. He served in the Deans’ Office for 12 years – six of those years as assistant head for student life. He and his wife, Lisa (associate director of college counseling), live on campus and have raised their three daughters at Peddie.

Bridgette McKnight ’10 joined the Alumni & Development Office as the associate director of engagement and reunions in 2023. Bridgette comes back to Peddie after spending 10 years in healthcare information technology and coaching high school girls basketball. She works to build relationships and volunteer opportunities to keep alumni engaged and connected with their alma mater in ways that are most meaningful to them. Bridgette received her Bachelor of Science in political science from The University of New Hampshire, where she was also a member of the women’s basketball team.

Claudio Middleton P’18 ’21 ’25 joined Peddie in 1999. He graduated with degrees in architecture and art history from the Catholic University of Valparaiso and was previously employed as a lecturer and project director in Chile. In addition to teaching Spanish, Claudio also developed Peddie’s current Architecture Program. He supervises Peddie’s ESL team, which he initiated and developed along with a community leader in Hightstown. Middleton shares dorm duty in Caspersen Dormitory and resides on campus with his wife and three children.

Emily Munch joined Peddie’s English Department in 2019. She received her Bachelor of Education in English and psychology from the University of Michigan, and is currently working on her English master’s degree at Middlebury College’s Bread Loaf School of English. In addition to her classroom duties, Munch is the head of the humanities team, head of the Writing Center, member of the Faculty Student Senate, an assistant coach for both varsity girls cross country and varsity softball and is part of the dormitory faculty in Avery Dorm.

Starting at Peddie in 1995, Mike O’Neill has taught English, served as a dorm supervisor, coached crew and cross country, and currently works as an admission officer and the director of financial aid. Mike and his wife live on campus and have six sons. Mike earned his bachelor’s degree in English from the College of the Holy Cross and his master’s in English and film from SUNY Buffalo.

Peter Park ’07 joined the Admission Office at Peddie in 2014. After earning his undergraduate degree in Cultural Anthropology from Northwestern University in 2011, Peter began his career in education with Teach for America as a middle-school English teacher in Kansas City Public Schools. Peter has returned to Peddie as an admission officer, is a faculty advisor for Taegeuk Club, oversees the Armellino Scholarship Program and serves as a dorm faculty member for upperclassmen boys in Potter South. He resides on campus.

Marisa Parra joined Peddie’s Language Department in 2015. A graduate of Buenos Aires University (Argentina), she worked in various day schools and boarding schools before joining Peddie. Parra is also a dorm supervisor in Masters Dorm, and the ddvisor of the LatinX affinity group. During summer breaks she travels extensively — learning and looking for new ideas and fun activities to bring back and share with her classes.

Wendi Patella P’17 ’20 joined the Office of Strategic Marketing and Communications in 2010. As director of strategic marketing and communications, she tells the Peddie story in creative ways to myriad audiences. Prior to coming to Peddie, Wendi managed her own communications firm, worked in public relations for state government and as a news journalist. She graduated with degrees in journalism and political science from Rutgers University.

Dr. Shani Peretz P’20 ’24 ’27 joined the Science Department in 2005 and is the 10th grade class dean. During her time at Peddie she has chaired the Science Department and founded the Research Science Summer Signature Program (STEM-EXP). Prior to joining Peddie, she earned her Ph.D. from Yale University and worked to set up clinical cancer research trials. Shani and her family live on campus and raise puppies for The Seeing Eye. They also love to travel and explore!

Corey Punter joined Peddie’s Admission Office in the fall of 2022. Prior to his arrival, he served as associate director of admissions at Fordham Preparatory School for five years and assisted in the fundraising efforts as a development associate with A Better Chance in New York. He resides on campus with his wife, Jessica, daughter, Roux and boxer, Bruce.

Sanjeev Puri P’25 joined the Peddie community in 2021 as the assistant head of school for finance and operations. Puri spent the first sixteen years of his career in the technology and business consulting industry, advising clients on re-engineering processes and leveraging technology to solve day-to-day problems. In 2014, he moved to education administration, taking up the role as chief operating officer at Woodstock School, one of South Asia’s most reputed international schools. Puri earned his bachelor’s degree from GB Pant University and his MBA from the National Institute of Industrial Engineering, both in India. He is excited to help in propelling Peddie’s strategic vision forward through operational excellence, financial sustainability and careful stewardship of resources. He resides on campus with his family and is a dorm faculty member in Kaye North.

Jose Roca joined Peddie in 1997 as head athletic trainer. As the liaison between the Athletics Department and the Health Center staff, he works to provide the highest quality of healthcare to all students engaged in physical activities. He is a certified athletic trainer in the state of New Jersey, which means he has earned a degree from an institution accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Athletic Training Education, passed a comprehensive exam administered by the Board of Certification, Inc., an independent cooperation that reviews the standards of practice and continuing education requirements, is licensed by the New Jersey Board of Medical Examiners and pursues mandatory continuing education.Jose also teaches Community Life and serves as dorm faculty and student advisor. He and his wife, Deb (Technology Department) live on campus and have two daughters.

Catherine Rodrigue joined Peddie in 2001 and is currently the associate head of school. Catherine has also served as assistant head of school and academic dean. She proposed and coordinated implementation of Peddie’s Signature Experience Program, developed a robust professional growth initiative and cultivated a collaborative professional culture. Catherine sets agendas for and leads Peddie’s Curriculum Committee, led two accreditation studies, and is a member of the Head of School’s Planning Committee. She resides on campus. Prior to joining Peddie, she taught English, history, and the humanities at several other institutions. Rodrigue has a history degree from University of Georgia and a master’s degree in English from University of Virginia.

Mark Sawula joined Peddie’s Mathematics Department in 2005. Sawula holds a bachelor’s degree from Princeton University and a master’s degree from the College of New Jersey. Prior to Peddie, Mark taught in South Carolina, Minnesota and Australia and held positions at Hewlett-Packard, Princeton Review and the SAT office in New York City. He helped develop the first GMAT course and is acknowledged in the Princeton Review GMAT book. Sawula coaches boys thirds soccer and serves as timer for the basketball team. He is part of Peddie’s dormitory faculty and resides on campus.

Dina Schwab joined the Alumni and Development Office as the director of donor relations in 2022. She oversees all the stewardship and recognition efforts required to effectively thank and recognize all our donors. She was inspired to join the world of nonprofit development when two courageous parents founded an autism organization, and invited her to be part of their team. Her career grew and transformed, along with the organization, Autism Speaks; she successfully led the organization’s New Jersey chapter, and continued serving the autism community for nearly two decades. Dina received her Bachelor of Fine Arts in advertising from The School of Visual Arts in NYC.

Doug joined the Peddie Alumni and Development Office in 2019 after more than 25 years of development experience in independent schools and higher education. His experience includes The Sidwell Friends School, Choate Rosemary Hall, George School and Susquehanna University. Doug earned his bachelor’s and master’s degrees from Binghamton University. As director of major gifts, Doug seeks to work with alumni, parents and friends of Peddie to help keep them connected to the school and to one another and to keep them informed about Peddie’s mission, vision and programs. Doug also works collaboratively with members of the Peddie family to discover how they might want to engage with and support the school in ways that are meaningful to them.

Karen E. Serach has been a librarian at The Peddie School since 2015. She holds her MLIS from Rutgers University and a Bachelor of Science in business from The State University College, Buffalo, N.Y. She has worked as a reference assistant in the Mercer County Library System. Karen is also the Peddie Student Book Club advisor.

Jordi Serrato joined Peddie’s Science Department in 2019. Jordi was raised in the eclectic heart of Mexico City. He holds a bachelor’s in pharmaceutical chemistry from the Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México UNAM, and a master’s in aquatic chemistry from the Marine Sciences and Limnology Institute in Mazatlan. Before joining Peddie, Jordi taught chemistry and physics at TMI Episcopal in San Antonio, Texas, and middle school science at Colegio Bosque Real and Colegio Suizo in Mexico. In addition to his teaching duties, Serrato also serves as a dorm parent in Potter South. Serrato is a proud husband and father, and proud to give a strong voice to students from underrepresented backgrounds. One of his goals is to serve and help future generations in becoming mindful and compassionate humans.

Joshua Sham joined the Peddie community in 2012 as a member of the Science Department. He received his Bachelor of Science in biomedical sciences from University of Buffalo and his Master of Science in science education from Syracuse University. Josh advises the SALAAM Affinity Group, and is a cross country coach. In addition, he is the Signature Experience Program coordinator, and the Peddie Summer Academy director. Josh is on the dorm faculty team in Potter South and resides on campus.

Sarah Somers has been a member of the History Department since 2006. She has served as department chair and assistant coach for varsity field hockey and varsity softball. Throughout her tenure, she has served on the Head’s Advisory Committee, the Faculty Student Senate, the Athletic Committee and the Prize Committee. Somers currently serves as a sophomore academic advisor, is a member of CORE and also mentors newly hired faculty in their transition to Peddie. She received her Bachelor of Arts in history from Moravian College and her Master of Arts in secondary education and history from The Catholic University of America. Somers teaches Modern Global History, The Contemporary History of East Asia, The History of Politics and Sports, Twentieth Century Foreign Policy and Race, Ethnicity and Migration (a class she created). She has a special interest in the global refugee crisis and contemporary African history. Somers is an advisor for gold key, lives on campus and is a part of the Caspersen Dorm faculty team.

Michael Stewart ’83 P’23 ’25 joined Peddie’s Science Department in 1993. Michael holds a Bachelor of Science in geology from Rutgers University. As part of the Math-Science Initiative, he developed the framework for the Summer Signature in the Sciences Program. In addition to his classroom duties, Stewart works with the Cross Country and Track and Field Programs, and is an advisor for Ski Club. He resides on campus with his family and serves as a dorm faculty member for Austin Colgate.

A former faculty child who has worked in schools for 25 years, Jim Truslow P’25 ’27 has a literal lifetime of experience in the field of education. As the director of external programs since 2006, Truslow helps Peddie engage with outside businesses and programs, including our summer schools and camps. He is the advisor for all service organizations, has overseen and built Peddie Summer Programs for eighteen years, as well as overseen the re-imagination of the Community and Service Program.Truslow received his bachelor’s degree from the University of Vermont, and has previously worked as the associate director for The Peddie School’s Annual Fund. He is a coach, dorm faculty member in Austen Colgate and Peddie’s representative to the Downtown Hightstown group. Truslow resides on campus with his wife Liz, daughter Brooke ’25, son Griffin ’27 and their dog Cider.

Mike Volkmar has served as the strength and conditioning coach at Peddie since 2009. Volkmar received his master’s degree in exercise science with a specialization in exercise, nutrition, and eating behavior from George Washington University. He worked for three years as the strength and conditioning coach at GWU, first with the Single A affiliate of the Milwaukee Brewers, and later with the Double A affiliate of the Washington Nationals. He spent one year at the International Performance Institute of IMG Academies in Florida before becoming the director of strength and conditioning at the APEX Academies. Volkmar has advanced specialty certifications (CSCS, PES, CPT) in strength and conditioning, post-rehab exercise, athletic development and sports medicine. He is the author of three books written specifically for the high school athlete.

Amanda Vos Strache joined Peddie’s History Department faculty in 2022. A graduate of Stanford University where she captained the field hockey team and majored in history, she has taught and coached at schools on both coasts. On top of her classroom teaching, Amanda is an assistant coach for varsity field hockey and varsity lacrosse. She serves as dorm supervisor for Green Dormitory, and currently resides on campus with her three children.

Tristram D. Wood P’12 ’15 ’19 joined Peddie as director of academic support in 1994. Wood received his Master of Education in special education from The University of Idaho, and his Bachelor of Arts in English from Hartwick College. Prior to Peddie, Tristram taught in Kildonan School in New York and Brewster Academy in New Hampshire. Tristram also completed practicum work in Northern Idaho public schools. Outside of his usual responsibilities, Wood is the girls junior varsity lacrosse head coach, and teaches English to post-graduates. He is part of Stringer Duty, and resides on campus with his wife, Leigh Wood and their three children.

Leigh W. Wood P’12 ’15 ’17 joined Peddie in 1994. Leigh teaches English and is the director of the Creative Writing Signature Experience Program at Peddie. She has previously served as a student dean and associate director of college counseling. Wood holds a bachelor’s degree in English from Denison University, and a master’s degree in English from University of Idaho. She resides on campus with her husband, Tris, and their family, and is part of the Caspersen Dorm faculty team.

After 20 years heading the Peddie Swimming Program as director of competitive swimming, Greg Wriede ’95 P’23 ’25 ’27 has assumed the role of director of student leadership development and student activities. Utilizing two decades of experience developing athletes who competed at the Olympic Games, Youth Olympic Games and World Championships, he turns his focus to working with the next generations of Peddie student leaders. Wriede resides on campus with his family.

Dominic Zhang joined Peddie’s Math Department in the fall of 2023. He graduated from Lafayette College in 2021 with degrees in physics, math and philosophy. After two years of teaching at the Northfield Mount Hermon School as a Penn Fellow, and obtaining his M.S. Ed degree in education from the University of Pennsylvania, he moved to Peddie to begin a new adventure. Zhang received a Knowles Teaching Fellowship in the spring of 2023, which supports and further explores ideas of pedagogy and education with new high school STEM teachers nationally. Outside of the classroom, Zhang is also the dorm supervisor for Austen Colgate, along with his dog, Toby, and is the assistant coach for boys varsity tennis.
